IR.H

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 //*****************************************************************
00002 // Iterative template routine -- Preconditioned Richardson
00003 //
00004 // IR solves the unsymmetric linear system Ax = b using 
00005 // Iterative Refinement (preconditioned Richardson iteration).
00006 //
00007 // The return value indicates convergence within max_iter (input)
00008 // iterations (0), or no convergence within max_iter iterations (1).
00009 //
00010 // Upon successful return, output arguments have the following values:
00011 //  
00012 //        x  --  approximate solution to Ax = b
00013 // max_iter  --  the number of iterations performed before the
00014 //               tolerance was reached
00015 //      tol  --  the residual after the final iteration
00016 //  
00017 //*****************************************************************
00018 
00019 template < class Matrix, class Vector, class Preconditioner, class Real >
00020 int 
00021 IR(const Matrix &A, Vector &x, const Vector &b,
00022    const Preconditioner &M, int &max_iter, Real &tol)
00023 {
00024   Real resid;
00025   Vector z;
00026 
00027   Real normb = norm(b);
00028   Vector r = b - A*x;
00029 
00030   if (normb == 0.0) 
00031     normb = 1;
00032   
00033   if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) <= tol) {
00034     tol = resid;
00035     max_iter = 0;
00036     return 0;
00037   }
00038   
00039   for (int i = 1; i <= max_iter; i++) {
00040     z = M.solve(r);
00041     x += z;
00042     r = b - A * x;
00043     
00044     if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) <= tol) {
00045       tol = resid;
00046       max_iter = i;
00047       return 0;
00048     }
00049   }
00050 
00051   tol = resid;
00052   return 1;
00053 }
